New Records: Mark Vientos became the youngest player in National League history to have three extra-base hits in a postseason game.
Key Match Events: Nick Castellanos walked off Philadelphia after Mark Vientos tied the game in top of ninth
Brandon Nimmo had a go-ahead home run in the top of the seventh inning
Luis Severino gave up a single, home run, and home run to three straight Phillies hitters, tying the game at 3-3 in the sixth inning
Pre-Game Insights: No pre-game insights were provided in the article
Post-Match Reflections: No post-match reflections were provided in the article
Miscellaneous Highlights: The series is now tied 1-1, with Game 3 at Citi Field on Tuesday.
Others: The Phillies rallied yet again in the late innings, tying the game in the ninth inning, but this time they lost anyway

It started with a one-out walk to Harper. Castellanos then lined a fastball to the opposite field toward the right field line for a single that sent Harper to third
Against lefty-hitting Bryson Stott, Diaz got a 3-2 count and then hung a slider that Stott lined down the right field line for a triple

Mendoza then brought in Megill who got a soft ground ball to Vientos at third base. Stott broke on contact from third and Vientos seemed to rush the play to the plate, bobbling and losing the ball to allow the Phillies to score an insurance run
